question: Question_01_(c)
statement:
How many years will it take for \$10 000 to grow to \$12 000 if it is
invested at 12\% annual interest compounded quarterly? You may leave
your answer in calculator-ready form.
hints:
``Quarterly'' compounding means that the investment is compounded four
times per year.

An investment with initial value $A_0$ compounded quarterly at interest
rate $r$ (per year) will grow to a value of

\begin{align*}A(t)=A_0(1+r/4)^{4t}\end{align*} after a time $t$ in years.
